title: ValueError: Expected more than 1 value per channel when training, got input size torch.Size([1, 512])
body:
Trying to use kernel shap, but this has become an arduous journey, as bogged in datatypes. 

```
batch = next(iter(train_loader)) # size -> 128, 
images = batch

background = images[:100]
test_images = images[100:]
print(">> ", test_images.shape) # torch.Size([28, 2307])
import pandas as pd
# +------------------------+
# |  kernel explainer      |
# +------------------------+
if __name__ == '__main__':
    background = pd.DataFrame(background)
    background = background.to_numpy(dtype=np.float32)
    test_images = pd.DataFrame(test_images)
    test_images = test_images.to_numpy(dtype=np.float32)

    f = lambda x: vaemsi.encoder(Variable(torch.from_numpy(x).float())).detach().numpy()

    kerexp = shap.KernelExplainer(f, background)
    shap_values = kerexp.shap_values(test_images)
```
generates the following error: 
```
    raise ValueError("Expected more than 1 value per channel when training, got input size {}".format(size))
ValueError: Expected more than 1 value per channel when training, got input size torch.Size([1, 512])
```

The model has `BatchNorm` layer. Is that why this is happening?
